intro: Ardisia darienensis, commonly known as the Darien ardisia, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Myrsinaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
